abstract: In addition to having mites and lice, swiftlets sharing caves with bats on Gawa Island, Papua New Guinea, potentially carry interesting internal parasites too.
snippet: In addition to having mites and lice, swiftlets sharing caves with bats on Gawa Island, Papua New Guinea, potentially carry interesting internal parasites too.
lead_paragraph: Jack Dumbacher, curator of ornithology and mammalogy at the California Academy of Sciences, writes from Milne Bay, Papua New Guinea, where he is studying island birds and their diseases.

headline.main: On Gawa, Swiftlets, Parasites and Limestone
